TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PrintSystemObjectPropertiesChangedEventArgs extends System.EventArgs implements class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Provides data for a PropertiesChanged event, which you must create.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!CAUTION] > Classes within the <xref:System.Printing> namespace are not supported for use within a Windows service or ASP.NET application or service. Attempting to use these classes from within one of these application types may produce unexpected problems, such as diminished service performance and run-time exceptions.
If you want to print from a Windows Forms application, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace.

Docs.param: A collection of strings, each of which identifies a changed property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases all resources used by the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Call <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjectPropertiesChangedEventArgs.Dispose> when you are finished using the <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjectPropertiesChangedEventArgs>. The <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjectPropertiesChangedEventArgs.Dispose> method leaves the <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjectPropertiesChangedEventArgs> in an unusable state. After calling <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjectPropertiesChangedEventArgs.Dispose>, you must release all references to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjectPropertiesChangedEventArgs> so that the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjectPropertiesChangedEventArgs> was occupying. For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
> [!NOTE] > Always call <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjectPropertiesChangedEventArgs.Dispose> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjectPropertiesChangedEventArgs>. Otherwise, the resources it is using are not freed until the garbage collector calls the `Finalize` method of the <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjectPropertiesChangedEventArgs> object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose(bool A_0) cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources that are used by the object and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is called by the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method. `Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the unnamed Boolean parameter set to `true`. <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with the parameter set to `false`.
When the Boolean parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources that are held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Printing.PrintSystemObjectPropertiesChangedEventArgs> references. This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.

block.para:
can be called multiple times by other objects. When overriding , be careful not to reference objects that were previously disposed of in an earlier call to . For more information about how to implement , see [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
For more information about and , see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Overriding the Finalize Method](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/8026cb68-fe93-43fc-96c1-c09ad7d64cd3).

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of the names of the changed properties.
